title: Drawing, "Textile Design: Diomedes", 1919
medium: Brush and  gouache, black ink, graphite on paper, mounted on smooth cream paper
markings: Stamped in red ink in lower right of mount: WIENER/WERK/STÄTTE
signed: In black ink, on mount below bottom right edge of  drawing: Dessin Diomedes.
inscribed: In black ink, on mount below bottom right edge of  drawing: Dessin Diomedes; in blue pencil on upper left of mount:48. Traces of erased graphite inscription on lower right of mount: Dessin Diomedes.
provenance: Wolfgang Ruf, Galerie Ruf, Rastatt, Germany
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds
description: Pair of stylized purple and orange leaves, arranged within a diamond-shaped pinkish background, formed by crossed diagonal purple lines (on the pink background).  At left, tip of purple leaf suggests pattern repeat.

exhibitions.title: Glass of the Avant-Garde: From Vienna Secession to Bauhaus
The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Textile Design: Diomedes", 1919.
1919. Brush and  gouache, black ink, graphite on paper, mounted on smooth cream paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds. 1988-62-621.
